newsitem.title: USA: Natural Law Party says it can meditate problems away.
newsitem.headline: Natural Law Party says it can meditate problems away.

text.p: From the people who brought you hundreds of "yogic fliers" who claimed to defy nature by levitating comes The Natural Law Party, a minor political party that nominated a presidential candidate on Thursday.
At a hotel convention here, the party associated with the Transcendental Meditation (TM) movement named physicist John Hagelin as its presidential nominee for the Nov. 5 election.
The party is running on a platform claiming it can ward off problems before they occur through techniques such as mass meditation that would reduce stress, crime, terrorism and even wars.
"Social stress can be reduced and problems such as crime and violence will automatically decrease," said a party paper.
Many party members are practitioners of TM, which involves meditating to a repeated word or phrase, called a mantra.

Some advanced TM followers contend they can actually mediate to such a point that they fly. But in a demonstration of "yogic flying" several years ago, critics said the people were merely bouncing off the ground from a sitting position.
